maqras.text: I do swear by the Day of Resurrection
And I do swear by the soul which is self blaming
Does man think that We will not gather his bones
Indeed, We were able to make his fingertips
No, man desires that he continues committing sins
He asks: "When is the Day of Resurrection
So, when the sight is dazzled
And the moon is eclipsed
And the sun and the moon are joined together
Man will say on that Day: "Where can I escape
No. There is no refuge
To your Lord on that Day is the abode
Man will be told on that Day what he has put forward, and what he has done
Indeed, man will testify against himself
Even though he puts forth his excuses
Do not move your tongue with it to make haste
It is for Us to gather and relate it
So when We relate it, you shall follow its revelation
Then it is for Us to explain it
Alas, you all like this world
And neglect the Hereafter
Faces on that Day will be shining
Looking at their Lord
And faces on that Day will be gloomy
Thinking that a punishment is coming to them
Alas, when it reaches the throat
And it will be said: "Who can save him
And he assumes it is the time of passing
And the leg is buckled around the other leg
To your Lord on that Day he will be driven
For he did not believe nor make the contact
But he denied and turned away
Then he went to his family admiring himself
Woe to you and woe to you
Then woe to you and woe to you
Did man think that he will be left neglected
Was he not a seed from sperm put forth
Then he was an embryo, so he was created and developed
Then He made from it the pair, the male and the female
Is One as such then not able to resurrect the dead
Was there not a time in the past when man was nothing to even be mentioned
We have created man from a mixed seed; We test him, so We made him hear and see
We have guided him to the path, either to be thankful or to reject
We have prepared for the rejecters chains and shackles and a blazing Fire
As for the pious, they will drink from a cup with the scent of musk
A spring from which the servants of God drink, it gushes forth abundantly
They fulfill their vows, and they fear a Day whose consequences are wide-spread
And they give food out of love to the poor and the orphan and the captive
We only feed you seeking the face of God; we do not desire from you any reward or thanks
We fear from our Lord a Day, which will be horrible and difficult
So God shielded them from the evil of that Day, and He cast towards them a look and a smile
And He rewarded them for their patience with a paradise and silk
They are reclining in it on raised couches, they do not have in it excessive sun nor bitter cold
And the shade is close upon them, and the fruit is hanging low within reach
And they are served upon with bowls of silver and glasses of crystal
Crystal laced with silver, measured accordingly
And they are given to drink in it from a cup which has the scent of ginger
A spring therein which is called 'Salsabeel
